description: Tests a CloudFront function. To test a function, you provide an event object that represents an HTTP request or response that your CloudFront distribution could receive in production. CloudFront runs the function, passing it the event object that you provided, and returns the function's result (the modified event object) in the response. The response also contains function logs and error messages, if any exist. For more information about testing functions, see Testing functions in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide. To test a function, you provide the function's name and version ( ETag value) along with the event object. To get the function's name and version, you can use ListFunctions and DescribeFunction.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the function that you are testing.

parameters.name: IfMatch
parameters.description: The current version ( ETag value) of the function that you are testing, which you can get using DescribeFunction.

parameters.name: EventObject
parameters.description: The event object to test the function with. For more information about the structure of the event object, see Testing functions in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: TestResult
nested_items.description: An object that represents the result of running the function with the provided event object.

nested_items.name: FunctionSummary
nested_items.description: Contains configuration information and metadata about the CloudFront function that was tested.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudFront function.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the CloudFront function.

nested_items.name: FunctionConfig
nested_items.description: Contains configuration information about a CloudFront function.

nested_items.name: Comment
nested_items.description: A comment to describe the function.

nested_items.name: Runtime
nested_items.description: The function's runtime environment version.

nested_items.name: KeyValueStoreAssociations
nested_items.description: The configuration for the key value store associations.

nested_items.name: Quantity
nested_items.description: The quantity of key value store associations.

nested_items.name: Items
nested_items.description: The items of the key value store association.

nested_items.name: KeyValueStoreARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the key value store association.

nested_items.name: FunctionMetadata
nested_items.description: Contains metadata about a CloudFront function.

nested_items.name: FunctionARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function. The ARN uniquely identifies the function.

nested_items.name: Stage
nested_items.description: The stage that the function is in, either DEVELOPMENT or LIVE.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the function was created.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the function was most recently updated.

nested_items.name: ComputeUtilization
nested_items.description: The amount of time that the function took to run as a percentage of the maximum allowed time. For example, a compute utilization of 35 means that the function completed in 35% of the maximum allowed time.

nested_items.name: FunctionExecutionLogs
nested_items.description: Contains the log lines that the function wrote (if any) when running the test.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FunctionErrorMessage
nested_items.description: If the result of testing the function was an error, this field contains the error message.

nested_items.name: FunctionOutput
nested_items.description: The event object returned by the function. For more information about the structure of the event object, see Event object structure in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide.
